body.p: Glass cube samples are taken from the gob or stream of glass in the hot end.

ul.li: At least one sample is needed per shift when glass is made.
Sample frequency can change depending on the operation or quality control requirements.

ol.li:
Take the sample from the gob to avoid air bubbles being entrapped in the glass.
Bubbles, cracks, or any other imperfection interferes with the color measurements.
Place ceramic wool and insulation board on the table next to the orifice opening.

PPE Required: Furnace gloves.
Hot molten glass.
Projectile hazard.
Place the glass mold under the gob or stream of glass.
Catch and fill the mold with glass.

PPE Required: Furnace gloves.
Hot molten glass.
Projectile hazard.
Use the flattening iron to press and flatten the glass into the mold.
Break any extra glass that is around the mold.

PPE Required: Furnace gloves.
Hot molten glass.
Projectile hazard.
Empty the glass sample on the insulation board or ceramic wool.
Use a hammer to hit the bottom of the mold to help remove the glass from the mold.

If you see any crack or imperfection on the glass sample, discard the sample.
Repeat steps 4-6.

PPE Required: Furnace gloves.
Hot molten glass.
Projectile hazard.
Cover with ceramic wool.
Set the sample to cool until it reaches room temperature. Around 2 hours.

Tag the sample and take to the lab for polishing and color measurement.
Continue to Glass Cube Polishing.
